mainEntity.name: Is mineral sunscreen better than chemical sunscreen?

acceptedAnswer.text: Mineral sunscreens use zinc oxide or titanium dioxide to physically block UV rays, while chemical sunscreens absorb them. Mineral formulations are reef-safe, less likely to irritate sensitive skin, and provide immediate protection upon application. Brush On Block uses zinc oxide, a premium mineral ingredient that provides broad-spectrum UVA/UVB protection without harmful chemicals.

mainEntity.name: How often should I reapply sunscreen?

acceptedAnswer.text: Dermatologists recommend reapplying sunscreen every 2 hours, or immediately after swimming or sweating heavily. Brush On Block's powder format makes reapplication throughout the day quick and convenient, even over makeup.

mainEntity.name: Can I use powder sunscreen as my only SPF?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, when applied properly with adequate coverage. For initial morning application, some users prefer combining with a cream SPF like our Sheer Genius SPF 50, then using powder for touchups throughout the day. Our SPF 30 Mineral Powder Sunscreen provides full broad-spectrum protection when applied correctly.

mainEntity.name: What are the key ingredients in Brush On Block products?

acceptedAnswer.text: Our products feature skin-loving ingredients: Zinc Oxide provides mineral-based broad-spectrum UVA/UVB protection; Niacinamide (Vitamin B3) hydrates and stimulates collagen production; Hyaluronic Acid draws moisture to skin and softens fine lines; and Vitamin C brightens and evens skin tone. These ingredients work together to provide sun protection plus skincare benefits.

mainEntity.name: What's the difference between SPF 30 and SPF 50 products?

acceptedAnswer.text: SPF 30 blocks approximately 97% of UVB rays, while SPF 50 blocks about 98%. Our SPF 30 Mineral Powder Sunscreen is ideal for daily use and easy touchups. SPF 50 Sheer Genius provides enhanced protection for extended outdoor exposure, beach days, or those with very fair or sun-sensitive skin.

mainEntity.name: Is Brush On Block TSA-approved for travel?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes! Our powder sunscreen format is TSA-approved and travel-friendly. The compact, spill-proof design makes it perfect for carry-on bags, purses, gym bags, and on-the-go sun protection.

mainEntity.name: Are your products cruelty-free and vegan?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Brush On Block products are cruelty-free. We never test on animals. Most of our formulations are vegan, though some may contain beeswax or other ingredients derived from animals. Check individual product pages for specific ingredient information.
